original: @150a # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @150a # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: pra ti mo ksha s'u tra bri tti /
analyzed: pra ti mo ksha s'u tra bri tti /

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: so sor thar pa'i mdo'i 'grel pa /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i mdo'i 'grel pa /
translated: The Commentary on the Pratimoksha Sutra

original: thams cad mkhyen pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Omniscient One!

original: 'di rnams kyi don ni 'og nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi don ni 'og nas 'byung ngo //
translated: The meaning of these [verses] will appear below.

original: 'di man cad tshigs bcad phyed dang gnyis ni au pa li'i sangs rgyas la bstod cing phyag bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di man cad tshigs bcad phyed dang gnyis ni au pa li'i sangs rgyas la bstod cing phyag bya ba ste /

original: de yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yon tan phun sum tshogs pa bzhi dang ldan te /
analyzed: de yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yon tan phun sum tshogs pa bzhi dang ldan te /

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: rgyu dang / gzhan gyi don dang / bdag gi don dang / 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang / gzhan gyi don dang / bdag gi don dang / 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: The perfect cause, the perfect benefit for others, the perfect benefit for oneself, and the perfect result.

original: yi ge gzhung dang thad kar sbyar ro //
analyzed: yi ge gzhung dang thad kar sbyar ro //
translated: They are directly applied to the text.

original: snyan pa'i ba dan 'jig rten gsum du grags //
analyzed: snyan pa'i ba dan 'jig rten gsum du grags //
translated: The banner of fame resounds in the three worlds.

original: rtsa ba 'di ni rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: rtsa ba 'di ni rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang sbyar te /
translated: This root is applied to the perfect cause.

original: de la snyan pa ni sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa dang / yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bsngags pa'am grags pa dang ldan pa nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: de la snyan pa ni sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa dang / yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bsngags pa'am grags pa dang ldan pa nyid la bya'o //
translated: Here, fame means the praise or renown of the Buddha's conduct and the possession of perfect good qualities.

original: ba dan ni dpe ste /
analyzed: ba dan ni dpe ste /
translated: The banner is an example.

original: mtshon lta bu gzhan las 'phags par snang zhing mngon pa bzhin du sangs rgyas kyang 'gro ba thams cad las 'phags par snang zhing mngon pa'o //
analyzed: mtshon lta bu gzhan las 'phags par snang zhing mngon pa bzhin du sangs rgyas kyang 'gro ba thams cad las 'phags par snang zhing mngon pa'o //
translated: Just as a banner appears and is seen as superior to others, so the Buddha appears and is seen as superior to all beings.

original: 'jig rten gsum du grags zhes pa ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams su sangs rgyas kyi yon tan grags pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum du grags zhes pa ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams su sangs rgyas kyi yon tan grags pa'o //
translated: As for renowned in the three worlds, the Buddha's qualities are renowned in the desire, form, and formless realms.

original: de la the tshom pas bya ba /üîΩ'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams na ni ldan pas grags su yang rung na gzugs kyi phung po med pas /
analyzed: de la the tshom pas bya ba / 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams na ni ldan pas grags su yang rung na gzugs kyi phung po med pas /
translated: Here, one might wonder,

original: de ni ji ltar grags par rung zhes bya ba'i lan du de ni sngon 'dod pa dang / gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de ni ji ltar grags par rung zhes bya ba'i lan du de ni sngon 'dod pa dang / gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa'i tshe /
translated: Since it is suitable for renown to occur in the desire and form realms through possession, how is it suitable for renown to occur in the formless realm, since there is no form aggregate there? In response to this, it is said that when one was born in the desire and form realms in the past, one accumulated the causes of renown.

original: sngon thos pa de yid la dran zhing shes pa yod pas de nyid la grags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sngon thos pa de yid la dran zhing shes pa yod pas de nyid la grags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since he has the knowledge of remembering and understanding that former hearing, it is called ‚Äúfame.‚Äù

original: de ji ltar rgyu phun sum tshogs pa yin zhe na /üîΩsbyin pa la sogs pha rol tu phyin pa bcu rab tu rdzogs pas /
analyzed: de ji ltar rgyu phun sum tshogs pa yin zhe na / sbyin pa la sogs pha rol tu phyin pa bcu rab tu rdzogs pas /
translated: How is he endowed with the perfect cause?üîΩHe is endowed with the perfect cause because he is famous for having perfected the ten perfections such as generosity.

original: sbyin pa chen po @150b dang ldan no zhes pa nas ye shes dang ldan no zhes pa'i bar du grags pas na rgyu phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa chen po @150b dang ldan no zhes pa nas ye shes dang ldan no zhes pa'i bar du grags pas na rgyu phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: He is endowed with generosity, and so on up to: he is endowed with gnosis.

original: dam pa'i chos sgra seng ge'i sgra bsgrags pa //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos sgra seng ge'i sgra bsgrags pa //
translated: He has proclaimed the lion‚Äôs roar of the sublime Dharma.

original: rtsa ba 'di ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: rtsa ba 'di ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang sbyar te /
translated: This root is applied to the perfection of the welfare of others.

original: de la dam pa ni skyes bu dam pa ste /
analyzed: de la dam pa ni skyes bu dam pa ste /
translated: In this regard, the sublime is the sublime being,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sgrib pa spangs pa'i mthar phyin cing bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang lhan cig pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sgrib pa spangs pa'i mthar phyin cing bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang lhan cig pa yin no //
translated: the Blessed Buddha, who has perfected the abandonment of obscurations and is endowed with the accumulations of merit and gnosis.

original: de la chos sgra ni sangs rgyas kyi bden pa bzhi la sogs dam chos bsgrags pa ste /
analyzed: de la chos sgra ni sangs rgyas kyi bden pa bzhi la sogs dam chos bsgrags pa ste /
translated: The lion‚Äôs roar of the Dharma is the proclamation of the sublime Dharma, the four noble truths of the Buddha, and so on.

original: des mu stegs can dang 'jig rten pa'i gtsug lag zil gyis gnon pa dper na ri dags kyi rgyal po seng ge ral pa can gyi sgra bsgrags pas byol song thams cad kyi sgra zil gyis gnon pa bzhin no //
analyzed: des mu stegs can dang 'jig rten pa'i gtsug lag zil gyis gnon pa dper na ri dags kyi rgyal po seng ge ral pa can gyi sgra bsgrags pas byol song thams cad kyi sgra zil gyis gnon pa bzhin no //
translated: It overwhelms the treatises of non-Buddhists and worldly people, just as the lion's roar overwhelms the sounds of other animals.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa rin chen mdzod brnyes pa //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa rin chen mdzod brnyes pa //
translated: He has found the jewel of omniscience.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ni bdag gi don dang sbyar te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ni bdag gi don dang sbyar te /
translated: Omniscience is related to one's own aim.

original: de la thams cad ces bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la thams cad ces bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is meant by everything?

original: bram zes gsol pa'i lan du bka' stsal pa las /
analyzed: bram zes gsol pa'i lan du bka' stsal pa las /
translated: In reply to the brahmin's request, the Buddha said:

original: bram ze thams cad ces bya ba ni skye mched bcu gnyis yin no zhes 'byung bas na /
analyzed: bram ze thams cad ces bya ba ni skye mched bcu gnyis yin no zhes 'byung bas na /
translated: Brahmin, everything is said to be the twelve sense bases.

original: skye mched bcu gnyis kyi nang du phyi nang gi chos ma lus par 'dus pas de dag mkhyen pa yang bya'o //
analyzed: skye mched bcu gnyis kyi nang du phyi nang gi chos ma lus par 'dus pas de dag mkhyen pa yang bya'o //
translated: Since all internal and external phenomena are included in the twelve sense bases, they are also known.

original: yang na 'dod chags dang bral ba stong zhing dben pa'i mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen pa yang yin no //
analyzed: yang na 'dod chags dang bral ba stong zhing dben pa'i mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen pa yang yin no //
translated: Or, it is the knowledge of the characteristics of freedom from attachment, emptiness and voidness.

original: yang gcig tu na dngos po thams cad mkhyen pa la bya ste /
analyzed: yang gcig tu na dngos po thams cad mkhyen pa la bya ste /
translated: Alternatively, it is the knowledge of all things.

original: de yang rnam pa bzhi ltar mkhyen te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bzhi ltar mkhyen te /
translated: That is also knowledge in four ways.

original: gang zhe na /üîΩma lus par mkhyen pa /
analyzed: gang zhe na / ma lus par mkhyen pa /
translated: What are they?üîΩKnowledge of everything without exception

original: ma 'dres par mkhyen pa /
analyzed: ma 'dres par mkhyen pa /
translated: Knowledge of everything without confusion

original: tshad med par mkhyen pa /
analyzed: tshad med par mkhyen pa /
translated: Knowledge of everything without limit

original: phyin ci ma log par mkhyen pa /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log par mkhyen pa /
translated: Knowledge of everything without error

original: de la ma lus pa ni gang /
analyzed: de la ma lus pa ni gang /
translated: What is knowledge of everything without exception?

original: dngos po gzugs la sogs pa ma lus pa mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po gzugs la sogs pa ma lus pa mkhyen pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of everything without exception, such as form.

original: ma 'dres pa ni sangs rgyas kyi mkhyen pa de nyid nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi shes pa dang ma 'dres par khyad du zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa ni sangs rgyas kyi mkhyen pa de nyid nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi shes pa dang ma 'dres par khyad du zhugs pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of everything without confusion is the knowledge of a Buddha that is distinguished by not being confused with the knowledge of sravakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: tshad med pa ni ji snyed shes par bya ba tshad med pa thams cad rab tu mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa ni ji snyed shes par bya ba tshad med pa thams cad rab tu mkhyen pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of everything without limit is the knowledge of everything that is to be known, without limit.

original: phyin ci ma log pa ni mu stegs can dang 'jig rten pa lta bu phyin ci log tu rtog cing shes pa ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa ni mu stegs can dang 'jig rten pa lta bu phyin ci log tu rtog cing shes pa ltar ma yin te /
translated: Knowledge of everything without error is not like the erroneous knowledge and understanding of the tirthikas and worldly people.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / lam gyi chos la sogs pa ngo bo nyid kyis ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / lam gyi chos la sogs pa ngo bo nyid kyis ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of the noble truths, the Dharma of the path, and so on, just as they are by nature.

original: de ni bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
translated: This is the perfection of one's own aim,

original: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyur yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyur yang 'gyur ro //
translated: and it also becomes the cause for the perfection of others' aims.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: bcings pa pa dang long bas gzhan dgrol zhing mtshon pa'i gnas /üîΩbdag grol bas gzhan dgrol ba'i gnas yod pa bzhin du bdag gi don chen po grub @151a * //
analyzed: bcings pa pa dang long bas gzhan dgrol zhing mtshon pa'i gnas / bdag grol bas gzhan dgrol ba'i gnas yod pa bzhin du bdag gi don chen po grub @151a * //
translated: The one who is bound and blind cannot liberate and guide others.üîΩBut when one is liberated oneself, it is possible to liberate others.

original: pas na gzhan gyi don yang grub par gyur te /
analyzed: pas na gzhan gyi don yang grub par gyur te /
translated: Thus, since one has accomplished one's own great aim, one also accomplishes the aim of others.

original: 'dis ni ye shes tshad med pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni ye shes tshad med pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows the immeasurability of wisdom.

original: de la rin chen mdzod ces bya ba la rin chen ni bstan pa'i chos te zhal nas gsungs pa'i mdo sde dang / bsgrub pa'i chos te bden pa bzhi dang lam gyi yan lag gi chos la bya'o //
analyzed: de la rin chen mdzod ces bya ba la rin chen ni bstan pa'i chos te zhal nas gsungs pa'i mdo sde dang / bsgrub pa'i chos te bden pa bzhi dang lam gyi yan lag gi chos la bya'o //
translated: Here, jewel treasury refers to the Dharma of teaching, which is the sutras spoken from the Buddha's mouth, and the Dharma of practice, which is the four noble truths and the factors of the path.

original: mdzod ces bya ba ni 'phags pa'i dge 'dun la bya ste /
analyzed: mdzod ces bya ba ni 'phags pa'i dge 'dun la bya ste /
translated: Treasury refers to the noble Sangha.

original: ci'i phyir rin po che'i mdzod du gdags she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rin po che'i mdzod du gdags she na /
translated: Why is it called the Jewel Treasury?

original: bstan pa'i chos dang bsgrub pa'i chos dag zag pa med pa'i dge 'dun de dag gis rdzogs par bsgrubs pas /
analyzed: bstan pa'i chos dang bsgrub pa'i chos dag zag pa med pa'i dge 'dun de dag gis rdzogs par bsgrubs pas /
translated: Because the Dharma of teaching and the Dharma of practice are perfected by that undefiled Sangha.

original: rin chen mdzod du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: rin chen mdzod du gyur pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is the Jewel Treasury.

original: brnyes zhes bya ba ni gong ma lta bu'i don phun sum tshogs pa brnyes pa yin te /
analyzed: brnyes zhes bya ba ni gong ma lta bu'i don phun sum tshogs pa brnyes pa yin te /
translated: As for attained, it means attaining the perfection of the above meaning.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: skal pa yod pa de dag la dge ba'i chos bstan nas zag pa'i dgra bcom pa yin te /
analyzed: skal pa yod pa de dag la dge ba'i chos bstan nas zag pa'i dgra bcom pa yin te /
translated: Having taught the Dharma of virtue to those with good fortune, they are the Arhats who have eliminated the defilements.

original: 'di ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang sbyar te /
translated: This is in connection with the perfection of others' goals.

original: 'di ni thugs rje tshad med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni thugs rje tshad med pa yin no //
translated: This is the immeasurable compassion.

original: zhabs la tshangs dbang gtsug gi nor bus gtugs //
analyzed: zhabs la tshangs dbang gtsug gi nor bus gtugs //
translated: Brahma and Indra bow their jeweled crowns at his feet.

original: rtsa ba 'dir ni 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: rtsa ba 'dir ni 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa dang sbyar te /
translated: Here, in this root text, it is in connection with the perfection of the result.

original: tshangs pa ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bas tshangs pa dang / bsam gtan dang po ris kyi lha'i rgyal po'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bas tshangs pa dang / bsam gtan dang po ris kyi lha'i rgyal po'o //
translated: Brahma is free from desire realm attachment, the king of the gods of the first dhyana realm.

original: dbang po ni sum cu rtsa gsum lha'i rgyal po ste //
analyzed: dbang po ni sum cu rtsa gsum lha'i rgyal po ste //
translated: Indra is the king of the Thirty-three gods.

original: lha rnams dbang byed bas na dbang po 'jig rten gyi mchog tu grags pa 'di gnyis kyi gtsug na rin po che yod pas kyang zhabs la gtugs te phyag 'tshal bas na /
analyzed: lha rnams dbang byed bas na dbang po 'jig rten gyi mchog tu grags pa 'di gnyis kyi gtsug na rin po che yod pas kyang zhabs la gtugs te phyag 'tshal bas na /
translated: Since he rules over the gods, he is known as the lord of the world. Since these two have jewels on their crowns, they bow down to the Buddha's feet and pay homage.

original: sangs rgyas ni 'gro ba thams cad kyi gtso bo sangs rgyas zhing mchod pa'i gnas su mngon te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni 'gro ba thams cad kyi gtso bo sangs rgyas zhing mchod pa'i gnas su mngon te /
translated: The Buddha is the foremost of all beings, manifestly the object of worship in the buddha-fields.

original: de bas na 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bas na 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, this is connected with the perfection of one's own goal.

original: sdug bsngal rgya mtsho gting mtha' med brgal ba //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rgya mtsho gting mtha' med brgal ba //
translated: Having crossed the fathomless ocean of suffering,

original: rtsa ba 'di ni bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: rtsa ba 'di ni bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa dang sbyar te /
translated: This root is connected with the perfection of one's own goal.

original: dper na rgya mtsho mching rnams zab cing rgya che ba bzhin du srid pa'i sdug bsngal dpag tu med pa las brgal ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: dper na rgya mtsho mching rnams zab cing rgya che ba bzhin du srid pa'i sdug bsngal dpag tu med pa las brgal ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yin par sbyar ro //
translated: Just as the ocean is deep and vast, the Blessed Buddha has crossed the immeasurable suffering of existence. This is how it is connected.

original: de la the tshom pas bya ba de ltar mtha' med na brgal zhes byar kyang mi btub ces pa'i lan du /
analyzed: de la the tshom pas bya ba de ltar mtha' med na brgal zhes byar kyang mi btub ces pa'i lan du /
translated: In response to the question, If there is no end to the world, how can one say that one has crossed over?

original: de ni dper na rgya mtsho chen po'i 'gram na gnas pas mtha' yod par mi shes pa bzhin du /
analyzed: de ni dper na rgya mtsho chen po'i 'gram na gnas pas mtha' yod par mi shes pa bzhin du /
translated: it is said that just as someone standing on the shore of the great ocean does not know that there is an end to the water,üîΩso the world's lowliest beings do not see or know that there is an end to the world.

original: sems can ma rabs kyis mtha' yod par mi mthong mi shes pas na mtha' med ces bya bar zad kyi /
analyzed: sems can ma rabs kyis mtha' yod par mi mthong mi shes pas na mtha' med ces bya bar zad kyi /
translated: Therefore, it is said that there is no end to the world.

original: 'phags pas kyang mtha' mi gzigs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pas kyang mtha' mi gzigs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But this does not mean that the noble ones do not see the end of the world.

original: 'gro ba'i gtso la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i gtso la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: I bow my head to the chief of beings.

original: rtsa ba 'di ni bdag don phun sum tshogs pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: rtsa ba 'di ni bdag don phun sum tshogs pa dang sbyar te /
translated: This root verse is related to the perfect fulfillment of one's own goal.

original: sangs @151b rgyas 'gro ba'i gtso bo yin par ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: sangs @151b rgyas 'gro ba'i gtso bo yin par ci mngon zhe na /
translated: Why is it said that the Buddha is the chief of beings?

original: mchog gsum zhes bya ba'i mdo sngags byung ba krang gnyis dang / rkang mangs thams cad kyi gtso bo ni sangs rgyas yin /
analyzed: mchog gsum zhes bya ba'i mdo sngags byung ba krang gnyis dang / rkang mangs thams cad kyi gtso bo ni sangs rgyas yin /
translated: The Sutra and Mantra scriptures state that the Buddha is the chief of all those with two feet, the chief of all bipeds, the chief of all those with feet, the chief of all quadrupeds, and the chief of all beings with many feet.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa'i chos thams cad kyi gtso bo ni 'dod chags dang ba'i chos yin /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa'i chos thams cad kyi gtso bo ni 'dod chags dang ba'i chos yin /
translated: He is the chief of all conditioned and unconditioned phenomena.

original: mang po thams cad kyi gtso bo ni dge 'dun yin zhes 'byung bas na /
analyzed: mang po thams cad kyi gtso bo ni dge 'dun yin zhes 'byung bas na /
translated: The foremost of all the many is the Sangha.

original: 'gro ba'i gtso bor de ltar mngon no //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i gtso bor de ltar mngon no //
translated: Thus it is evident that it is the foremost of beings.

original: spyi bos phyag byas ni lhag par dad cing gus pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: spyi bos phyag byas ni lhag par dad cing gus pa'i tshul lo //
translated: Having bowed one's head to it is the manner of especially believing in and respecting it.

original: 'di man chad rtsa ba gnyis ni gong ma ltar bstod par byas zin nas /
analyzed: 'di man chad rtsa ba gnyis ni gong ma ltar bstod par byas zin nas /
translated: From here on, the two roots are praised as above.

original: 'di ltar das so sor thar pa'i mdo dgrol zhing rgyas par ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar das so sor thar pa'i mdo dgrol zhing rgyas par ston pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is the S≈´tra of Individual Liberation, which is to be unraveled and explained in detail.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i bslab gzhi dkon mchog snod //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i bslab gzhi dkon mchog snod //
translated: The basis of training of the Omniscient One, the vessel of the Three Jewels,

original: 'phags pa'i tshogs kyi dbus su dbye bar bya //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i tshogs kyi dbus su dbye bar bya //
translated: Should be unraveled in the midst of the assembly of the Noble Ones.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ni ltag tu smos pa dang 'dra /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ni ltag tu smos pa dang 'dra /
translated: The Omniscient One is like what was said above.

original: bslab pa ni gang mi bya ba'i dngos po rnams te /
analyzed: bslab pa ni gang mi bya ba'i dngos po rnams te /
translated: The training is the things that should not be done,

original: srog mi gcad pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: srog mi gcad pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: such as not taking life.

original: tshig ni gang mi bya ba'i dngos po de dag ma byed cig par bstan pa ste /

translated: Among them, the childish are those who do what should not be done.

original: mi dge ba bcu la sogs pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu la sogs pa byed pa'o //
translated: They do the ten unwholesome actions and so forth.

original: de lta bu ma mthong na mi bsten pas 'khrugs pa med pa'i phyir bde ba nyid du 'gyur zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu ma mthong na mi bsten pas 'khrugs pa med pa'i phyir bde ba nyid du 'gyur zhes bya'o //

original: de la rtsa ba dang po gnyis ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pas bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba bstan /
analyzed: de la rtsa ba dang po gnyis ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pas bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba bstan /
translated: Among them, the first two roots are taught as the cause of happiness through relying on the spiritual friend.

analyzed: 'og ma gnyis ni mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen spangs pas bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba bstan pa yin no //

analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni 'phags pa yin te /

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: And he is of two kinds.

original: @156b gang zhe na /
analyzed: @156b gang zhe na /

analyzed: kun rdzob kyi 'phags pa dang / don dam pa'i 'phags pa ste /

analyzed: kun rdzob kyi 'phags pa ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi yan lag la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor can la bya'o //
translated: The conventional noble person is the practitioner who is established in the branches of serenity and insight.

original: de la tshul khrims dang ldan pa ni gang lus dang ngag gi spyod pa bdun spangs pa dang / rang bzhin dang bcas pa'i nyes byas yan cad mi spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de la tshul khrims dang ldan pa ni gang lus dang ngag gi spyod pa bdun spangs pa dang / rang bzhin dang bcas pa'i nyes byas yan cad mi spyod pa'o //
translated: Here, possessing morality means to abandon the seven physical and verbal actions and not to engage in any misdeed, even if it is as small as an atom.

analyzed: 'gro ba mang po bag phebs pas de dang bsten cing dge ba la 'jug par 'gyur bas /

original: bde ba'i rgyu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bde ba'i rgyu zhes bya ste /

original: dge slong gnod pa med pa'i ngang tshul can du gyur pa la byol song kun kyang bag phebs par bstan pas na /
analyzed: dge slong gnod pa med pa'i ngang tshul can du gyur pa la byol song kun kyang bag phebs par bstan pas na /

analyzed: rngon pa lta bu 'ang dge slong gi lta bur 'jug cing bol song la gnod pa byed pa yin no //

original: di ni zhi gnas kyi yan lag dang sbyar ro //

original: mdor na gzugs la chags pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba dang zag pa dang bcas pa la skyo bar bya ba'i chos rnams rab tu thos pa la bya'o //
analyzed: mdor na gzugs la chags pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba dang zag pa dang bcas pa la skyo bar bya ba'i chos rnams rab tu thos pa la bya'o //

analyzed: bde ba ni mang du thos pa des gzhan gyi lta ba dang 'gyod pa dang the tshom sel par byed pas na bde ba'i rgyu zhes bya'o // de ltar na tshul dang ldan pas zhi gnas gyi yan lag la gnas pa dang ldan pa bstan /

original: mang du thos pas lhag mthong gi yan lag la gnas pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mang du thos pas lhag mthong gi yan lag la gnas pa bstan pa yin no //

analyzed: 'di man chad rtsa ba gnyis ni don dam pa'i 'phags pa'i yin par ston pa'o //

original: yang sred rnam par grol ba yi //
analyzed: yang sred rnam par grol ba yi //

original: dgra bcom pa dag mthong ba bde //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa dag mthong ba bde //

analyzed: dgra bcom pa dang mchod par 'os pa zhes bya mod kyi /

analyzed: yang na dgra bcom pa'i mchog gi bas pa rnyed pa yang yin no //

original: de lta bu mthong na rjes su mos shing sems dang ba dang bstan rjes spyod par 'gyur bas na bde ba'i rgyu zhes bya'o //'bab stegs zhes bya ba 'di man chad nas /

translated: To see such a person is a cause of happiness, because one will have faith in him, one‚Äôs mind will be clear, and one will follow his teachings.üîΩThe verse from ‚ÄúThe river of happiness‚Äù up to

translated: ‚ÄúThe end of pride is happiness‚Äù teaches the cause of happiness that is to be attained and the cause of happiness that is to be practiced.üîΩThe river of happiness

analyzed: bde ba'i chu klung bde //
translated: is the water of happiness.

original: 'bab stegs ni chu bo'i 'gram lta bu bden /
analyzed: 'bab stegs ni chu bo'i 'gram lta bu bden /

translated: In the same way, if one wishes to attain the knowledge of liberation,

original: shes rab rab tu thob pa bde //
analyzed: shes rab rab tu thob pa bde //

analyzed: nga'o nga rgyal zad pa bde //

original: nges par bya ba'i man chad nas yal ba rnams kyang bde zhes bya ba'i bar du tshigs bcad gcig ni sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pas bde ba'i rgyur bstan pa yin no //

translated: The verse from ‚Äúhaving made a resolution‚Äù up to ‚Äúis happy‚Äù shows that the one who possesses the virtues of austerity is the cause of happiness.

analyzed: de yang dus 'ga' tsam du bsrung ba ma yin no //

analyzed: 'dis ni yi dam bcas pa dang po rnam par dag pa bstan to //
